Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial on Imaging Surveillance After Endovascular Aortic Repair

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to evaluate the effects of imaging surveillance compliance on reintervention rates and mortality in patients undergoing endovascular aortic repair (EVAR).

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the reintervention rate, and the secondary outcome was all-cause mortality, measured over a median follow-up of 31.7 months.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The overall reintervention rate was 5%, with a risk difference (RD) of 4% (95% CI 1% to 7%) favoring partial/noncompliance, implying a number needed to harm of 25 (95% CI 14 to 100).

Trial_Registration.evidence: The review protocol was registered at PROSPERO (CRD42017080494).
